title: Use `actions/checkout@v4` everywhere
body:
`actions/checkout@v3` are using NodeJS 16, which has been deprecated in CI.
So every time this version of the action is used, it will generate a warning, like the one displayed here:
https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/9322372854

```
[start-message](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/9322372854/job/25663307940)
Node.js 16 actions are deprecated. Please update the following actions to use Node.js 20: actions/checkout@v3, actions/github-script@v6. For more information see: https://github.blog/changelog/2023-09-22-github-actions-transitioning-from-node-16-to-node-20/.
```

Furthermore, we have been using v3 and v4 in the same file/action.
This PR unifies the version of the action and sets is to the currently supported v4.
author: nemanjaglumac
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: temporarily removes the SameSite=None suggestion box
body: ### Description [Slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1717429725205379?thread_ts=1717422303.389629&cid=C063Q3F1HPF). The box is suggesting to use SameSite=None even when that will not work, for example when MB is running on localhost:3000 and the authorized origins is localhost:9000 (see https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43462) We're temporarily removing the suggestion box until we come up with a proper solution. I created https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43523 to not forget about it and to leave a reference in the code
author: npretto

title: [cache] config should be editable if entity is accessible
body:
According to [that Slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C06KX7QECN4/p1716497021301599) we should give access to cache configuration to everyone who can write to a given entity.

New logic: you can edit cache settings if you're able to access the entity. For root cache configuration and for lists of entities - you have to have access to settings to see/edit them.
author: piranha

title: Fix bulk action delete button hover contrast
body: Closes #43136 ### Description The "Delete permanently" bulk action button had bad contrast on hover. This change modifies the background color / font color on hover to help with visibility. ### How to verify 1. Go to /trash 2. Use the select checkbox to select an item in the trash for a bulk action 3. Hover over the delete option ### Demo Default Hovered Disabled ### Checklist - [ ] ~Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~ Not needed

title: feat(sdk): SDK theming part 2 - bg-error, bg-medium, bg-night, bg-white, border
body:
Relates to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42694
Also is a small part of https://www.notion.so/metabase/100-Align-approach-to-Mantine-styles-customization-1066f77c43694c36a6e90a3d2374b731

### Description

Migrate hardcoded colors used in emotion styles:

- bg-error `${color("bg-error")}` -> `var(--mb-color-bg-error)`
- bg-medium `${color("bg-medium")}` -> `var(--mb-color-bg-medium)`, `--color-bg-medium` -> `--mb-color-bg-medium`
- bg-night `${color("bg-night")}` -> `var(--mb-color-bg-night)`
- bg-white `${color("bg-white")}` -> `var(--mb-color-bg-white)`
- border `${color("border")}` -> `var(--mb-color-border)`

### How to verify

1. CI should pass
2. Visual tests should return same results
author: deniskaber

title: Demonstrate nesting dynamic redefines
body:
Refs #43471 

### Description 

Recently we ran into trouble performing a call to an earlier definition of a function, within a later dynamic redefinition of it. 

From my perspective this is working as expected, as one must bear in mind that function vars are late binding so it is actually expected behavior for such a "shallow reference" to resolve the *latest* binding, triggering infinite recursion. We could also argue that this is an unnecessary foot gun, but I don't see a way to get around it.

This PR adds a test demonstrating the "correct" way to perform this sort of monkey patching, and to make this easier it also renames and exposes a method which encapsulates the internals.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]
comments_list: [{'comment_id': 2145105436, 'issue_id': 2331050154, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': 'It could be nice detect infinite recursion and give a more helpful "did you mean to capture the current value of the binding? here\'s how" message. We\'d probably still want to use stack depth, rather than assuming the functions are pure. I\'m not sure if the cases where we\'d run into this will be common enough that it\'s worth extra code and runtime overhead though.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 3, 12, 41, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2145111840, 'issue_id': 2331050154, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': '@camsaul let me know what you think about this pattern', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 3, 12, 44, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2150507957, 'issue_id': 2331050154, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': "I've updated the issue reference so that it won't close the issue.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 5, 16, 42, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2150508594, 'issue_id': 2331050154, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@crisptrutski Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 5, 16, 43, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
crisptrutski (Issue Creator) on (2024-06-03 12:41:08 UTC): It could be nice detect infinite recursion and give a more helpful "did you mean to capture the current value of the binding? here's how" message. We'd probably still want to use stack depth, rather than assuming the functions are pure. I'm not sure if the cases where we'd run into this will be common enough that it's worth extra code and runtime overhead though.

title: refactor public/embed reducers and related code
body:
### Description

It should be easier to review it commit by commit

The `dashboard` and `parameters` reducers are used in both `reducers-main` and in `reducers-puglic` so I moved them to the file with the other common ones.

I also took the opportunity to convert the files to typescript and convert the default exports to named, to increase readability and discoverability (cmd+f etc)

### How to verify

Nothing should break in CI

title: fix(sdk): Fix map visualizations breaking
body:
Closes #42767

This PR adds a `metabaseInstanceUrl` key to the SDK slice of the store which we can then pass to the `ChoroplethMap` visualization component. We can then inject the instance URL to the link to the map visualizations.

title: Athena jdbc driver upgrade to 3.2
body:
Closes #35965

This PR upgrades Athena jdbc driver to 3.2. Changes:
- TIMESTAMP WITH TIMEZONE is returned as Timestamp instead of VARCHAR, 
- different shape of DESCRIBE results,
- differences in getTables results,
- differences in connection properties.

title: Set min bar height for non-zero bars
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41291 ### Description When a bar series have a wide extent so that small values are estimated as less than 1px they can appear invisible which can be misleading. This PR sets min bar height to 1px as it was in the previous implementation. Unfortunately, the ECharts `barMinHeight` option applies even to bars that represent zeros. To avoid that, we need to replace zeros with nulls. However, it led to not having data labels for zeros. So fixing that required hackish code both in data transformations and the labels formatting. ### How to verify Create a bar chart ```sql SELECT 1 x, 100000000 y UNION ALL SELECT 2, 100 UNION ALL SELECT 3, 1 UNION ALL SELECT 4, 0 UNION ALL SELECT 5, NULL ``` Enable data labels. Ensure, there is 1px bar for y = 1, no bar for y = 0, and the data label for y = 0 exists ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr

title: Skip fingerprinting or scanning field values for fields with base_type=type/*
body:
Fixes the escalation https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43461

Fingerprinting and scanning field values for fields with `base_type=type/*` are costly in time and resources and have little value.

A field will typically have `base_type=type/*` if either: (a) the database type has not been mapped to a base type by the driver or (b) the database type is such that its value should not be inspected (e.g. [the geometry type in postgres](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/ba6c96493a108ad2fc49f72f1a7bfde91515523f/src/metabase/driver/postgres.clj#L681)).

We already skip fingerprinting and scanning field values for some fields, such as JSON fields. So excluding fields with `base_type=type/*` is an extension of this behaviour.

One downside of this PR is that we will omit fingerprinting and scanning field values for fields where base_type=type/* but actually make sense to fingerprint or scan field values. But that can and should be remedied by correctly classifying the column with a more granular `base_type`. Driver authors can use a type deriving from `:type/TextLike` instead of `:type/*` if a database type should still be fingerprinted and scanned, and displayed as text but should not be treated exactly as text. I've reclassified the MySQL ENUM type to be `type/TextLike` in this PR: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43533
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix LDAP admin settings form not allowing modification if a custom port is set
body:
Closes #41494

### Description

Our TS types weren't matching reality if the user didn't change the port number and tries to modify + save the LDAP form after having already configured it. This was due to the server providing a number and the client wanting a string, which resulted in our `.trim` call during submission to fail. If the user re-enters the exact same port number that is already configured, the form would work as expected.

### How to verify

- setup a ldap locally via the admin settings
- refresh the page
- change something like the host from localhost to 0.0.0.0
- you should have seen an error before, but not with these changes

### Checklist

- [ ] ~Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~
I don't have a good way to test this given our e2e LDAP host is configured on the default port of 389, which ends up nulling out this value / avoiding the issue we're noticing (notice related issue has a different port number configured). I can spend more time there, but I think it would be better to spend the effort on converting some of our admin settings to typescript which would have surfaced this error via the type system.
author: sloansparger

title: make compact formatting consistent across all series
body: ### Description Previously, when data labels formatting was set to "auto", we for each individual series computed whether its labels should be compact or not. However, we [decided](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064QMXEV9N/p1717113341767579) to go with consistency and now we propagate compactness to all series if it is sensible for at least one series. This applies to stack total labels as well: if all series auto formatting is full but totals should be compact, we render all labels as compact ones. ### How to verify - check visual specs variants - try different combinations of multiseries charts where compactness propagates to all series ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: fix stacked data labels on ordinal charts
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43454

### Description

Fixes stacked data labels are not displayed on stacked ordinal charts.
The root cause is the typo: 
```
// before
const originalDatumIndex = datum[ORIGINAL_INDEX_DATA_KEY ?? index];
// after
const originalDatumIndex = datum[ORIGINAL_INDEX_DATA_KEY] ?? index;
```

### How to verify

Check stacked data labels are visible on ordinal x-axis charts manually or look at the spec: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/compare/fix-stacked-labels-on-ordinal-charts?expand=1#diff-8b8db4b613397b6444b5d4f70803b2a6d3a1f0012af74bb30cdc18885d01c590

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Add can_run_adhoc_query to Card hydration
body:
Fixes #43386

Adds a new card property - `can_run_adhoc_query` which gives the same results as `queryDisplayInfo(query).isEditable` but 1) doesn't require heavy computation on the FE 2) doesn't require metadata to be loaded. For now this new property is only used in dashboards to fix immediate performance issues.

How to verify:
- CI is green

title: Populate Macaw options based on database type
body:
Closes #43096

SQL standards are one thing, and production SQL engines are another. We've recently added some options to Macaw to handle some of these differences, and this PR is concerned with populating those options based on the database being queried.

title: [DataScript] Proof of concept for storing MBQL queries in DataScript
body:
This is a proof of concept exploring the possibilities of using DataScript to represent metadata and queries.

It's a long way from compatible with MLv2 currently, but I think it implements enough of the MLv2 logic
to show that this approach is viable, and indeed has excellent leverage for exploring and updating queries.

The main advantages are:
- Refs are now real, indexed DB keys!
    - They can be navigated in both directions as keys on smart Entity maps.
- Queries are still immutable, opaque objects that can be passed around in the FE.
- Much of the logic is simpler and much faster: less inference and reconstruction, more querying and navigating.
- No danger of ambiguous refs - refs to columns are real DB refs, and so cannot be confused for "the same column" from
  another source.
    - There are many tests of eg. joining the same table several times and using each column separately.
- `remove-clause` is beautiful!
    - The schema is annotated to mark those relationships which cause cascading deletes.
    - Walk the DB along those edges, find all the things that should be deleted.
    - Delete them!

There's plenty of commentary in `metabase.lib.datascript` which will hopefully be clear.

If you're not familiar with DataScript, Datomic or "triple stores" in general, I can suggest:
- The [Overview of Datomic](https://docs.datomic.com/datomic-overview.html)
    - Bearing in mind that Datomic is a distributed, durable database, and DataScript is an in-memory version
    of the same basic model.
    - See especially the [Information Model](https://docs.datomic.com/datomic-overview.html#information-model),
      [Benefits](https://docs.datomic.com/datomic-overview.html#benefits),
      [Tradeoffs](https://docs.datomic.com/datomic-overview.html#tradeoffs) and
      [Indexes](https://docs.datomic.com/datomic-overview.html#indexes) sections.
- Much of the [DataScript Tutorial](https://github.com/kristianmandrup/datascript-tutorial/tree/master?tab=readme-ov-file#datascript)
  but especially the [Entity Identity](https://github.com/kristianmandrup/datascript-tutorial/blob/master/entity-identity.md)
  page for understanding `[:metadata.field/id 123]` entity refs, and `:db/unique` schema attributes.
- [Learn Datalog Today](https://www.learndatalogtoday.org/) for the Datalog query syntax
    - Though it's actually used in only a few places in this PoC; mostly it's powered by the smart Entity maps.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('Stale', 'Stale PRs that will be auto-closed'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Bump mysql2 from 3.9.7 to 3.9.8
body:
Bumps [mysql2](https://github.com/sidorares/node-mysql2) from 3.9.7 to 3.9.8.
Release notes

Sourced from mysql2's releases.

v3.9.8

3.9.8 (2024-05-26)

Bug Fixes

  • security: sanitize fields and tables when using nestTables (#2702) (efe3db5)
  • support deno + caching_sha2_password FULL_AUTHENTICATION_PACKET flow (#2704) (2e03694)
  • typings: typo from jonServerPublicKey to onServerPublicKey (#2699) (8b5f691)
Changelog

Sourced from mysql2's changelog.

3.9.8 (2024-05-26)

Bug Fixes

  • security: sanitize fields and tables when using nestTables (#2702) (efe3db5)
  • support deno + caching_sha2_password FULL_AUTHENTICATION_PACKET flow (#2704) (2e03694)
  • typings: typo from jonServerPublicKey to onServerPublicKey (#2699) (8b5f691)
Commits
  • f637d3f chore(master): release 3.9.8 (#2700)

title: Fix unit tests running multiple times in watch mode
body:
I've been non-deterministically experiencing this since forever and today I finally decided to debug it.
I hooked in [here](https://github.com/jestjs/jest/blob/fa24a3bdd6682978d76799265016fb9d5bff135e/packages/jest-core/src/watch.ts#L255) and investigated which file changes are being reported.
It turned out that there were "redundant" files being watched in `resources/frontend_client/app/dist` (e.g. `app-embed.hot.bundle.js`, `app-public.5755bae4fdc7ab6ff631.hot-update.js`, etc.).
Regenerating those files takes some time, so they're updated with a delay, often after the test has already ran - that's why it caused tests to run again.

Related [Slack discussion](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C505ZNNH4/p1711543635527349).

title: Repro #37380 - Users with no self-service access may update pivot tables and leave them in a non-working state
body:
Closes #37380

### Description

This is just a repro, the issue has been fixed by using [`Lib.canSave`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/fb4b8ca2a60fede819fff9362956941ccccadbcb/frontend/src/metabase/query_builder/components/view/ViewHeader/ViewHeader.jsx#L467-L468) in 0.49.

Adding the test in an existing file instead of a dedicated one (see [Slack discussion](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C5XHN8GLW/p1717022207142969)).

### How to verify

title: Fix mariadb failed to migrate due to having deep nested revision
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41924

MariaDB throws an error when json_extract on a nested json with more than 32 level deep. Even though I'm not sure how it's possible that a revision could be this nested, but it happens.

So we fix it by doing the migration in clojure land for mariadb like we do it for h2.

title: Add SDK changelog
body:
This is required for #43364 to work. The file is generated with tag `embedding-sdk-0.1.5`

#### Explanation
The workflow in #43364 expects the changelog file to already exist, since this file has never been here before, it's not updating the file as you could see in this PR https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43387 that it doesn't contain the changelog. The reason is that the I commit with `git commit -a` that will only include all modified and deleted files, but not the new files.

I could modify the script to always try to add the changelog like `git add changelog-path` but that might raise a question why we only need to add this file when we're changing the readme and the packge.json template files as well.

I want to keep things consistent, and expecting that the changelog file is already exist is reasonable.

title: Catch exceptions from driver/database-supports? outside driver code
body:
This PR prevents issues like [this](https://github.com/ClickHouse/metabase-clickhouse-driver/issues/242) happening again by logging errors instead of throwing exceptions when a call to `driver/database-supports?` throws an exception.

One reason why exceptions thrown in `driver/database-supports?` has a huge blast radius is the exception will bubble up the call stack every time we call `t2/select` on a database entity using toucan. We call `driver.u/features` on the database in the after-select hook, which calls the driver/database-supports? method:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/6979c8869fb820c97e0ccbed8c9d63d3f7d1c138/src/metabase/models/database.clj#L184

We also call `driver/database-supports?` in many other important places, for example in the `GET /api/database` handler to check whether the database supports the `:schemas` feature. It's therefore really important that any exceptions thrown during its execution are handled gracefully.

### Linter changes

I've added a lint rule to discourage the use of `driver/database-supports?` outside tests and namespaces matching `metabase.driver*`. Instead, we should use `driver.u/supports?` from now on, which wraps `driver/database-supports?` with timeout and error handling.

title: Don't throw an exception when a non-existent setting is in the config file
body:
This PR changes the behaviour when a setting in the config file doesn't exist. 

Currently whenever you remove or rename a setting, metabase_database column, or core_user column, Metabase will fail to start for any customers that have set its value via the config file. This makes it harder to refactor settings or database columns. To make the changes backwards compatible but we have to carefully deprecate columns or settings and remove them after a period of time.

With this PR, we don't throw an exception when a non-existent setting is set in the config file.

The desire for the new behaviour was checked [here on slack with the rest of the team](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/CKZEMT1MJ/p1717081485713669?thread_ts=1716828710.408369&cid=CKZEMT1MJ).

title: Improve haveDashboardCardsChanged util performance
body:
### Description

A performance based unit test is failing in master for `haveDashboardCardsChanged` which expects a comparison of two 1000 card sets to be determined as equal in under 100ms  (example: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9306286700/job/25616198364). 

This function was O^2(n *m) and this refactors it to O^(n*m). The refactor in testing reflects this with 48% reduction in time  over 5000 iterations of the failing test. **This refactor however assumes that there would be no duplicate `QuestionDashboardCard`s within one of the inputs _which I'm not sure is a valid assumption_.**


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: remove unused timeseries interval
body:
Part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41905

### Description

Previously we had the following two timeseries intervals in our echarts implementation:

```typescript
  { unit: "year", count: 2, testFn: (d: Dayjs) => d.year() % 2 }, // (18) 2 years
  { unit: "year", count: 5, testFn: (d: Dayjs) => d.year() % 5 }, // (19) 5 year
```

The 2 year interval was new, it did not exist in the dc.js implementation. However, because we added it, we violated the invariant that each interval of the same unit, needs to be a multiple of the smaller ones

```typescript
// NOTE: smaller modulos within an interval type must be multiples of larger ones (e.x. can't do both 2 days and 7 days i.e. week)
```

Because of this, the two year interval would always be selected instead of the five year interval, because two and five are co-prime. 

Initially, I tried to resolve this by removing the two year interval, since it did not exist in the dc.js implementation, while keeping the five year interval. However, this looked bad, as many charts used the two year interval, and with the five year interval instead, the x-axis tick labels became incredibly sparse since it's a wide range. For example, some charts would just show a single label on the entire x-axis.

Thus, I decided instead to keep the new two year interval, and to remove the unused five year interval.

### How to verify

CI - yarn test-visual:loki-update

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: feat(sdk): SDK theming part 1 - black, bg-light, bg-dark, bg-black
body:
Relates to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42694
Also is a small part of https://www.notion.so/metabase/100-Align-approach-to-Mantine-styles-customization-1066f77c43694c36a6e90a3d2374b731

### Description

Migrate hardcoded colors used in emotion styles:

- black `${color("black")} ->var(--mb-color-bg-black)`
- bg-light `${color("bg-light")} -> var(--mb-color-bg-light)`
- bg-dark `${color("bg-dark")} -> var(--mb-color-bg-dark)`
- bg-black `${color("bg-black")} -> var(--mb-color-bg-black)`

### How to verify

1. CI should pass
2. Visual tests should return same results
author: deniskaber

title: Rework Kondo `defendpoint` custom macro to be a custom hook instead
body:
Part of #43414

Just ran into something interesting with Kondo + LSP

`M-x lsp-find-definition` doesn't seem to work for me inside things that we use custom Kondo macros for. I was looking at the `defendpoint` for `POST /api/card/:id/copy` 

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/f3ddcb66a700d8104b01c0b605383bcde285be19/src/metabase/api/card.clj#L478-L487

and hitting `M-.` on the `card/create-card!` call inside it and it didn't work... LSP just jumped me to the top of the `defendpoint` form itself. I looked at our Kondo config and we're using a custom macro there. I rewrote it as a custom hook instead and now my LSP jump-to-definition works as expected.

This PR replaces the `defendpoint` Kondo macro with a hook instead.
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Prep unit tests for React 18 upgrade
body:
Related to #43375

### Description

Pulls out all the changes required to make upgrading to React 18 + React Testing Library 15 possible but happen to be backwards compatible with React 17 + RTL 12. The changes were extracted from #41577 with the goal that we can backport this PR to minimize the diff between `master` and the current release branch, while also keeping our React 18 upgrade branch as small as possible.

Most changes fall into a few categories:
1. Use `await userEvent.click(el)` over `el.click()` (or similar event methods)
2. Use `act` where needed (generally for reacting to route changes or dispatched redux events)
3. Use `find` methods over `get` (I _think_ to account for async scheduling of the React 18 renderer)

### How to verify

- Unit tests should pass

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: sloansparger
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Fix duplicate filter panels in fullscreen dashboards
body: In fullscreen dashboards, we used to display the filter panel inside the header. We stopped at some point, but didn't remove the code for that. Some recent changes brought them back while also keeping the main panel in place. This PR fixes the issue, so we always show the filters right below the header and nowhere else ### To verify 1. Open a dashboard with filters 2. Open the "More" menu in the top right ("..." icon) and select "Enter fullscreen" 3. Ensure filters are not duplicated ### Demo **Before** **After**
author: kulyk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Force loading metadata before queries
body:
https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0645JP1W81/p1717073476748389

The browser tries to be too smart and delays the metadata request even when it's sent first. As we block everything on metadata we need to load it before the cards. This PR mostly reverts previous changes in this area and uses the single BE endpoint for metadata.
author: ranquild
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: #41973 Improvements + Convert PublicQuestion to TS
body:
Improvements based on @WiNloSt's review on #41973 

- [Uses `isEmbeddingSdk` instead of `isSdk`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41973#discussion_r1620169554)
- [Removes `div` from `PublicApp` test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41973#discussion_r1620221169) 
- [Converts `EmbedFrame` to a named import](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41973#discussion_r1620209339)
- [Converts `SyncedEmbedFrame` to `EmbedFrame` in `PublicQuestion`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41973#discussion_r1620205549)
	- I converted the component to typescript as it was easy and allows me to use the hook from `SyncedEmbedFrame` directly
author: oisincoveney

title: Load metadata before queries
body: Based on stats, calling metadata after `query` is bad for performance because with many cards the browser doesn't send the metadata request until most of `query` requests are resolved. As we block rendering of the dashboard until metadata is loaded, it makes sense to send this request before `query`.
author: ranquild
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

### How to verify

CI is green

title: Leave viz-setting part as is if normalization fails
body:
Fixes #43089.

The correct solution would probably be to make normalization context dependent, but that would be significantly more work and would need to be maintained each time the shape of viz settings changes.

title: Populate collection search results with effective parent
body:
Pursuant to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42979

Fixes the `:collection` field on collection search results so that it contains details about the collection's effective parent, rather than the collection itself, which was the prior behavior.

title: Combine Filters Reproduction into new e2e job
body:
resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43345

This improves e2e CI performance by:
- increasing parallelization of some of our slowest e2e suites
- combining lots of little test files into a couple larger ones to reduce test setup overhead

spec | time
-- | --
Filters | 28 min ‚û°Ô∏è  21 min
Dashboard-filters | 27 min ‚û°Ô∏è  18 min
filter-reproductions (new) | 9 min
author: iethree
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Avoid unnecessary re-renderings in dashcards
body: ### Description We used to pass new references to dashcard visualizations, what caused re-renderings. It can be avoided with memoization ### How to verify CI is green ### Demo For demo I resized the window by dragging the devtools panel, see the number of renderings and time required to re-render ### Before ### After ## Video Tests are done on the same dashboard using CPU throttled by X6, you can notice some difference in rendering ### Before https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/9931a6a3-01c2-429a-b7dc-8410cc491411 ### After https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/7dc502a1-ede1-46f2-b3b7-4bb4bcd0c5a6

title: Multiple Measures Requires Additional Header Row in Pivot Exports
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43325

Mulitple measures can be set in our pivots. We indicate these properly in the fronted with a header row that shows which measure is reprsented in that particular column.

The header builder fn in the pivot export post processing didn't handle this case, but after this PR, it correctly adds the final header when necessary.

title: Add font fallbacks to charts rendering context
body:
Closes #43175

After the charts migration, axis labels and ticks were rendered with the wrong font when exporting as PNG. This seems to be a limitation of the `html2canvas` library we're using for exports (related issue https://github.com/niklasvh/html2canvas/issues/1463). Apparently, dc.js charts didn't use Lato either, but were using Arial as a fallback. This PR brings the fallback back to echarts until we find a better solution

### To verify

1. Open any line/area/bar chart
2. Click the "Download" button at the bottom right
3. Select "PNG"
4. Ensure the text isn't serif
author: kulyk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Do not use MBQL lib for parameter fields in dashboards when possible
body:
We've already removed many `parameter.fields` dependencies in favour of mappings, but parameter widgets need real database fields and this cannot be removed. This PR exploits the fact that we only care about database fields and optimizes field lookup in simple cases. I expect that these checks should cover 99% real world cases.

How to verify:
- CI is green

body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43289, part of the preparation work for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42628

"Public" is a bit confusing as when we talk about public sharing we mean public links, but the code uses Public also for static embedded related things.

We [discussed about it](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1716821967657249) and decided to make the name more explicit.

The pr should be small enough to be readable on its own, but I tried to make commits pretty small anyway in case you want to read it commit by commit

title: Fix remaining `tinyint` booleans in MySQL
body:
Liquibase changed their boolean type in MySQL from `bit(1)` to
`tinyint(4)` in version 4.25.1. Our JDBC driver does not recognize these
as booleans, so we converted them to `bit(1)`s.

As discussed [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/36964), we
changed all existing `boolean` types that were in the
`001_update_migrations.yml` but not the SQL initialization file.

For new installations, this works: things in the SQL initialization file
get created with the `bit(1)` type.

However, for existing installations, there's a potential issue. Say I'm
on v42 and am upgrading to v49. In v43, a new `boolean` was added.

In this case, I'll get the `boolean` from the liquibase migration rather
than from the SQL initialization file, and it need to be changed to a
`bit(1)`.

I installed Metabase v41 with MySQL, migrated the database, and then
installed Metabase v49 and migrated again. I made a list of all the
columns that had the type `tinyint`:

```
mysql> SELECT TABLE_SCHEMA, TABLE_NAME, COLUMN_NAME, COLUMN_TYPE,        COLUMN_DEFAULT, IS_NULLABLE FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE COLUMN_TYPE = 'tinyint' AND TABLE_SCHEMA='metabase_test';
+---------------+------------------------------+-------------------+-------------+----------------+-------------+
| TABLE_SCHEMA  | TABLE_NAME                   | COLUMN_NAME       | COLUMN_TYPE | COLUMN_DEFAULT | IS_NULLABLE |
+---------------+------------------------------+-------------------+-------------+----------------+-------------+
| metabase_test | core_user                    | is_datasetnewb    | tinyint     | 1              | NO          |
| metabase_test | metabase_field               | database_required | tinyint     | 0              | NO          |
| metabase_test | metabase_fieldvalues         | has_more_values   | tinyint     | 0              | YES         |
| metabase_test | permissions_group_membership | is_group_manager  | tinyint     | 0              | NO          |
| metabase_test | persisted_info               | active            | tinyint     | 0              | NO          |
| metabase_test | report_card                  | dataset           | tinyint     | 0              | NO          |
| metabase_test | timeline                     | archived          | tinyint     | 0              | NO          |
| metabase_test | timeline                     | default           | tinyint     | 0              | NO          |
| metabase_test | timeline_event               | archived          | tinyint     | 0              | NO          |
| metabase_test | timeline_event               | time_matters      | tinyint     | NULL           | NO          |
+---------------+------------------------------+-------------------+-------------+----------------+-------------+
10 rows in set (0.01 sec)
```

Then wrote migrations. For each column, we:

- turn it into a `bit(1)`,

- re-set the previously existing default value, and

- re-add the NOT NULL constraint, if applicable.

I (@johnswanson) didn't have to do this for `report_card.dataset` as @SakuragiYoshimasa had already done it for me - many¬†thanks! When I was investigating why this had gotten missed originally, I uncovered the other columns that needed updating.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40600
author: SakuragiYoshimasa
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2150940315, 'issue_id': 2322869507, 'author': 'johnswanson', 'body': "Hi @SakuragiYoshimasa , thank you so much for opening this PR!

When I was looking into this I noticed that there are quite a few more `tinyint`s left in MySQL if you update from an older version to v49, so I pushed a fix for those as well. Also, I hope you don't mind me force-pushing to your branch - we usually do rebases onto `master` rather than merging it in.

Your changes look great to me, I'm just going to get someone else on the team to take a quick look at the rest of them and we can get this merged.

Thanks again for your help here!", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 5, 20, 50, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2153305061, 'issue_id': 2322869507, 'author': 'nemanjaglumac', 'body': '@metabase-bot backport release-x.49.x', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 6, 19, 56, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2153306465, 'issue_id': 2322869507, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@nemanjaglumac something went wrong while creating a backport [[Logs]](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9407026307)', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 6, 19, 57, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

Also, I hope you don't mind me force-pushing to your branch - we usually do rebases onto `master` rather than merging it in.

title: Use MultiAutocomplete in dashboard filters
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43290

### Description

Use the `MultiAutocomplete` component in dashboard filters where applicable.

This PR is big because this small change touches a lot of usecases and the way we test the component is different.

The tests need to be updated in basically three ways:
- We can no longer just use `cy.get("input")` or similar because the `MultiSelect` component renders multiple inputs (on of which is hidden, one of which can be used). I've added a helper `multiAutocompleteInput` to find the input instead.
- We can no longer use `cy.icon("close")` to find the close button in the combobox, I've added a helper `removeMultiAutocompleteValue(idx)` instead.
- The `MultiAutocomplete` component renders suggestions in it's own popover, some tests needed to be rewritten to pick the value from the correct popover.


### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/bd1cdf10-4bf8-499a-b817-905091860a91
author: romeovs

title: Minor design updates to multi select
body: This PR fixes all the design feedback from [Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0645JP1W81/p1716938901194639?thread_ts=1716793316.573389&cid=C0645JP1W81): > @maz: > - The font size in the new component‚Äôs tokens looks really small to me. I think it‚Äôs 11px instead of the expected 14px. (See screenshot) > - I wish that the new component‚Äôs tokens had that light blue background color with brand blue text: I think it adds some nice color and personality. > - I saw on Stats that the info icons here on the far right are too dark ‚Äî I assume they should either be text-dark to match the icon on the left, or should be light like in your second screenshot. > - should this info-tooltip icon maybe only show up when the input has focus. ### Demo

title: [Browse] Show Browse models link in nav only when there are models
body:
When there are no models, the Browse > Models link in the nav will not appear. 

On master, if the user also has no data access, the Browse > Databases link will not appear. On this branch, if both links are hidden then the whole Browse section of the nav will not appear.

Normally the API request that checks for the existence of models will be fast, but here's an illustration of the edge case where that one request takes several seconds longer than the others to complete:

![Kapture 2024-05-28 at 23 32 14](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/1fd6bb24-82e8-4b5d-8ab5-cd27bc41e771)

Closes #43253

title: [Browse] Don't show filter icon when no models have been verified
body:
On the Browse models page we have a filter icon which opens a popover with a switch that toggles "Show only verified models". On this branch, the icon is not rendered if there are no verified models at all.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43262.

title: Single metadata endpoint for a dashboard
body:
Fixes #43156

  New endpoint that combines responses for `/api/field/:id`, `/api/dashboard/:id`, `/api/dashboard/:id/schemas`,
  and `/api/table/:id/query_metadata`. This should drastically cut down on the required number of requests to display a
  dashboard.

Adds a defenterprise for table query metadata, as EE overwrote the route but we want to make sure we provide filtered fields in our combined response which does not call the route directly.
author: snoe

title: [QP] Drop last stage aggregations for questions in chain filtering
body:
Models are treated as opaque here, but for a saved question we expose
filters on the query before its final aggregation step.

This drops the aggregation clauses and gets the possible values for the
column of interest.

Fixes #43154.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Combine question e2e reproductions into fewer specs in a different job
body:
resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43344

## Description

e2e-questions is consistently our slowest CI job, with a median run time of 32 minutes.

There's some non-trivial overhead in cypress to running separate spec files. This combines 47 small files into 3 bigger ones ü§û 

No test changes here, just combining files and moving to a different directory

32 minutes ‚û°Ô∏è 17 minutes + 10 minutes in parallel üî•
author: iethree
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: [drivers] Enable `:regex` feature for MySQL (and MariaDB)
body:
These databases previously had impoverished support for regular
expressions. The `:regex` driver feature requires advanced,
"Perl-compatible" regular expressions that can do things like lookahead
assertions.

- MySQL supports this from 8.0.4; we recommend 8.0.33+.
- MariaDB supports this from 10.0.5; we recommend 10.4+.

Fixes #43180.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: feat(sdk): font size scaling and adjustment for visualizations
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42692 ### Description Before this, `theme.fontSize` used to only affect the SDK container's base font size. This PR makes the `theme.fontSize` settings affect the majority of viz typography, such as data tables, chart typography, axis ticks and series labels. The typography should scale relative to the base font size. This also adds in optional settings to adjust viz font sizes: `table.cell.fontSize` and `cartesian` properties. This is used internally to apply `px` units to the Metabase app, while applying `em` relative values so they scale relative to the `theme.fontSize` value. I've exposed this as it's useful to the user despite not being part of the original goals. We convert the `em` values to `px` for echarts to use in offset and padding calculation. ### How to verify - Go to the Metabase app and open questions/dashboards. The default font sizes should NOT change. - Go to the `test-chart-font-size-scaling` branch in the demo app. - Go to the Kitchen Sink page. - Go to `AppProvider.tsx` and change `theme.fontSize` to `12px`, `14px`, `16px`, `18px` and `20px`. Notice the changes to the viz. - Change `table.cell.fontSize` and `cartesian.label.fontSize`, which should affect data tables and cartesian charts. ### Limitations These typographic elements are not yet affected by font size scaling. This will be addressed in a future PR. - Pie chart's ring label and center label - Funnel chart's bottom label - Pivot table's cell ### Demo Unset `theme.fontSize` or set to `14px` `theme.fontSize` set to `18px` (+4px) ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR - visual tests (line & bar chart)

title: Revalidate x-axis scale when graph.dimensions change
body:
Closes #25156

We didn't revalidate the `graph.x_axis.scale` setting when `graph.dimensions` was changed. We could have a numeric dimension with linear scale, then change the primary dimension to a date, and break the chart because the linear scale isn't available. Fixed by extending the `isValid` check for `graph.x_axis.scale`

**To verify:** follow the steps from the original issue

### Demo

**Before**

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/17258145/4e50791b-f3b4-4bd5-a8d6-0957b5d09a7b

**After**

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/17258145/8d190fe7-99a2-406e-954d-400d8e6133e5

title: Fix a couple of flaky tests using `with-call-count`
body:
This PR loosens a couple of tests that use `t2/with-call-count` that are known to be flaky. These tests aren't critical so it's better to be a bit looser and have no flakes IMO.

Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43153 and https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43256

title: ü§ñ backported "A couple of changes to the sample content"
body:
backports  #43200
resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43190

This is a non-trivial backport. The original PR could not be backported easily because it depended on the trash collection being created, but that was removed from the 50 branch in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43159.

The changes from the original PR (https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43200) are in this commit: 7727891678841ee0e169959ecf8aca0fb9936e3d. 

In summary:
1. I removed `:trashed_from_collection_id` and `:trashed_from_location` in `sample-content.edn`
2. I changed `:collection_id 2` to `:collection_id 1` in `sample-content.edn`
3. I updated `example-collection-id` from 2 to 1 here https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/64b8643d93fada252c6cb7547fd33b6fce9f0708/src/metabase/db/custom_migrations.clj#L1204

title: Support importing testing utilities in SDK builds
body:
The embedding SDK build is failing in `master` due to use of `__support__/*` imports in testing utilities. This PR adds support for importing testing utilities in SDK's `tsconfig.sdk.json` - this uses the same value as `tsconfig.json` in our main app.

## How to test
- Run `yarn build-embedding-sdk:watch`. The type checking step should no longer fail with errors related to importing `__support__`.
author: heypoom
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: [wip] Improve performance of Browse models with various techniques
body:
This branch explores various methods for improving the performance of the Browse models table - specifically speeding up the initial page load, sorting, and resizing:
- rendering the first 30 rows right away and the others lazily - this makes the page load and sort very fast
- deprioritizing the work done in the truncation hooks that support the tooltips - this helps make resizing smoother
- memoizing the call to emotion's css function - this speeds up the page load
- optimizing the sort function

Closes #43014
author: rafpaf
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Show the columns for the correct stage when using combine/extract in the presence of an aggregation
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43222

### Description


### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Start a new question
2. Try to add custom column via Extract column or Combine column shortcut
3. Notice you can select all the right columns in there
4. Add an aggregation
5. Try to add custom column via Extract column or Combine column shortcut **before** the aggregation

It should show the correct columns from the first stage.
author: romeovs
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 28, 11, 31, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2137086391, 'issue_id': 2320803705, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': ' [Codenotify](https://github.com/sourcegraph/codenotify): Notifying subscribers in CODENOTIFY files for diff 58867ab7016da08ab33de36ee7c56bc163339960...c5c505389ec38d44ab4392c993b2df30e9a65b92. | Notify | File(s) | |-|-| | @alxnddr | frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/click-actions/actions/CombineColumnsAction/CombineColumnsAction.tsx
frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/click-actions/actions/ExtractColumn/ExtractColumn.tsx |', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 29, 10, 31, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2139353165, 'issue_id': 2320803705, 'author': 'romeovs', 'body': "@ranquild > Doesn't work in Chill Mode when the query only has breakouts (no aggregations). Wrong columns are suggested, the new column is invisible because it's from the inner stage. I think it should be correct to do the following: > > * Remove asReturned in all places > > * You do not need any special logic with stages in the notebook editor. Just use `expressionableColumns` on the current stage. > > * In Chill Mode (column header drills, shortcuts) check for aggregations and breakouts on the last stage. If there are aggregations OR breakouts, append a new stage, and then work with latest stage normally using `expressionableColumns`. Similar to what `FilterModal` does https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/2aa3cec610588238132afbc789da0845c7c2ec5d/frontend/src/metabase/querying/components/FilterModal/utils/filters.ts#L11 Furthermore, this PR implements your two first points. Can you provide an example (ie. step-by-step reproduction) on how it breaks in chill mode?", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 30, 11, 30, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: Temporal unit parameters in dashboards
body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42118
Demo https://www.loom.com/share/13078400d1724220a5500669e5fe064e (autowiring on adding a new parameter was reverted, but regular one works).

Allows to add a temporal unit parameter that can be mapped to breakout columns in MBQL queries that allow changing the unit. 

How to verify:
- Add a question with a temporal breakout to a dashboard
- Add a "unit of time" parameter to the dashboard
- Connect it to the card
- Make sure you can change the temporal granularity 
- Make sure you can open the question when there is a filter and change is propogated to the QB

Tests tbd in a separate PR. Now there is a single e2e test.
This is currently very raw and I expect issues until the testing plan is implemented.

title: Fix parameter matching with model columns
body:
Partially addresses https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43154
Context https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C052ZBWRG3W/p1716819811048979

Complex to verify locally, please use the added e2e test instead. The remaining bit is that the QP throws an error when the question has an aggregation; there is a skipped E2E test for that.

Changes:
- Make `getParameterTargetField` work only for real database fields as we cannot match an arbitrary column this way
- Fix other places to use mapping options -> find mapping option flow that works with all columns

title: feat(sdk): pivot table color customizations
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42947 ### Description This PR applies the theme configuration from `theme.colors` and `theme.components` to the Pivot Table visualization in the embedding SDK, allowing for more color customizations in the SDK. The pivot table uses the table cell's colors to derive the emphasized cells and hover colors. ### How to verify - Verify that the theming/colors in the dashboard does not change. - Go to the `test-pivot-table` branch in the demo app. - Open the `AppProvider.tsx` and change the settings in `theme.colors` and `theme.components` - Go to the kitchen sink page. - The pivot table should use the configured style accordingly ### Demo Styling should remain the same in the dashboard. Using "cell background" and "cell text color" to achieve white table even in apps with dark backgrounds. Colored pivot table, with customized row toggle color. When `colors.background` is set, the pivot table takes on a transparent appearance. ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR (Loki - Visual Test)
author: heypoom
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: A couple of changes to the sample content
body:
Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43190

Epic that introduced sample content: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40066

I edited the sample dashboard and re-exported [`sample-content.edn`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43200/files#diff-9fd64e2ae9cec09e97fdc4e057d6a18f9d5fee8f8522bdc89fb417ea505cfdcb) using [this script](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43200/files#diff-be85115f22d8821f0a204e2c870538dc80f6c4191640e6f02c7cc558dbda6544R1249)
1. Removes "top selling products" question - not used, seems like the correct one in use is "best selling products"
Filters only appear to be wired to some questions in one of tabs
2. Wires filters to all of the tabs, not just the last tab.

I've made some changes to the code that generates `sample-content.edn`, and updated them with comments.
author: calherries

CI is green

title: Update macaw for qualified rename support
body:
This updates our Macaw dependency to bring in qualified name support for renames. This version in fact requires all columns to be qualified, and all table names to be in a map, so it also updates the corresponding test cases.

This change is blocked on [this new flag being added](https://github.com/metabase/macaw/pull/41), which will require bumping our version yet again once that merges.

title: Replace automatic wiring of the cards with opt-in variant via toast button
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43184

[figma](https://www.figma.com/design/mcmJekuToH3AyvL8cDhlo9/Make-Dashboard-filter-auto-wire-less-presumptuous?node-id=1-286&t=Vx8Lg8AQ2WfBKE5p-0)

### Description

This PR changes the behaviour of auto-wiring during mapping, adding new card and replacing a card in the dashboard.

Main changes:
- auto-wiring works only in the current tab
- we stop automatic wiring, instead we show a toast with the message to click a button to enable auto-wiring
- toast text is updated - it depends on the number of tabs and includes filter name and dashcard name
- toast timer is updated to 12s (a new progress bar will be added in a separate PR)
- e2e tests updated accordingly with the new default behaviour (no auto-wiring)

quick demo

1. Multi-tab

### mapping + new card

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/25ed663d-eb0b-48e5-ace4-b51696e68ddb

### replace card


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/78f29d56-6616-48c6-9e61-5f689ee65708


### several filters are connected


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/01bb52a4-9d2c-4caf-bcbf-8a3e83fa889e




2. Single Tab


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/e2f09613-5c1f-417f-886a-2db023960b98
author: uladzimirdev

title: Correctly place "Add column" button and allow using it when summarizing
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43173 Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43118 ### Description - Hide the "Add column" shortcut for questions it does not apply to. - Make the "Add column" shortcut work for questions with aggregations. - Make the "Add column" shortcut stick to the last column if there is space. - Update the button to use the outline variant (https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43118) ### How to verify 1. New question -> Sample Dataset -> Orders 2. On a wide screen the "Add column" button should sit next to the last column, on a smaller screen it should be sticky at in the top right of the header 3. Add a summarization (ie. count by Created At) 4. The "Add column" actions should continue to work. ### Demo https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/78ee46a3-3f3e-43cf-9f0d-d925d66f160f ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix multiple origins support by handling invalid origins
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42631

### Description

This fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/42888 which was reverted because it broke staging.
The issue was caused by the logic not supporting "invalid" input, such as multiple spaces in the authorized origins. This caused parse-url to be called on "" which caused the "Invalid URL" exception.

`approved-origin?` now never throws, to make sure this won't break the BE for an invalid input.
It will instead log an error if it gets an invalid input.


- 6337f67f557bc8652af84e82780c83a57ec08d84 reverts the revert, to put back the original code in the PR
- 2eb30b1c8dfcfe9c20f0aead631b5909548fb6f7 extracts a `parse-approved-origins` function that will be tested and improved in the other commits
- 26b02220bc1814b8dabda3d9d0a1c0cb347973e1 implements the fix for the multiple spaces
- 0052ec8795c820d648d2d834c7ae9b24348f0e71 moves the calls of `parse-url` for the approved origins inside `parse-approved-origins` and filters out invalid origins, to make the code more robust
author: npretto
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Improve models table performance
body:
resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43014 

> [!Note]
> Long term, we really need a good virtualization solution for this table, but with these optimizations we can provide a great experience for users with small (<300) sets of models (over 99% of instances), and an acceptable experience for instances with up to 1000 models.

### Description

![Screen Shot 2024-05-24 at 2 44 15 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/f33f36c6-5739-4f67-9d70-d63ec2f77fee)

The Models table is very slow on instances with large numbers of models. In the real world, 99% of metabase instances [have fewer than 100 models](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064EB1UE5P/p1714587584628579?thread_ts=1714560307.962039&cid=C064EB1UE5P). However, our product team is increasingly encouraging the creation of models, and features like CSV upload make it easy to create hundreds of new models, so this feature should be usable with up to 1000 models (the max returned by the API currently).

Currently, on an instance with 1000 models, the browse models table takes 10+ seconds to render (even after data is fetched).

![Screen Shot 2024-05-24 at 2 27 15 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/d5006391-b1fa-42dd-b527-8dd5ee10f345)

The biggest culprit here is the collection path column which does some very cool and fancy measurement logic to show you as much of the collection path as possible given your screen size. These calculations are fairly CPU intensive, though this is trivial on small sets of data.

## 1. Simplify collection display on large datasets

This introduces one very simple performance optimization: it uses a simpler collection column component for instances with more than 500 models.

![Screen Shot 2024-05-24 at 2 38 18 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/6a1163a9-2c66-4c8f-ab48-452110e0ef98)

This improves performance by about 4x, which is still not great, but is much closer to being usable.

![Screen Shot 2024-05-24 at 2 37 29 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/68db499a-b2df-4dcc-aa58-4fcfa3e320c6)

## 2. Introduce loading state on large datasets

The most significant way this hurts user experience is by making the application feel unresponsive when clicking on the browse models tab. 

Before: nothing happens for a long time when you click the models tab
![nothingHappens](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/0a0d95a8-a52c-493d-b720-cbbd0478aa2a)

After: the browse tab appears instantly, and you get not-awesome, but also not-broken loading text, which makes the app feel much more responsive. 

![loading behavior](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/922ef2de-a16f-4d15-99fc-19396ddaa308)


### How to verify

- set up 1000+ models in your metabase instance
- click on the browse models tab
- wait for things to hang
author: iethree
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Fix connection impersonation when jdbc spec is passed

title: Backfill `:effective-type` for coerced fields
body:
Closes #42931

This PR adds functionality that backfills `:effective-type` for coerced fields.

Apart from disappearing filter, mentioned in the linked issue, there was another problem occurring on master only. Query execution was completing with error. Reason was same as for the filter disappearance -- coerced fields contained `:base-type` only (no `:effective-type`), hence query containing those did not pass schema validation.
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Add events to measure search performance
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43017

### Description
Updates events generated by searches, as well as adds events for when items are clicked as a result of searching.

### How to verify
No changes to the UX should be there, but CI has been updated to ensure that events are being emitted

### Checklist
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

Tunes `maxTicksForChartWidth` calculation to prefer smaller time series intervals in certain cases. A combo of 5px char width and the 10px tick buffer seem to produce readable results

Closes #43121

title: [Dashboard] Optimize rendering by reducing the number of props passing down to from the very top
body: ### Description This PR attempts to optimize rendering of the dashboard by using changing props as close as possible to the actual components where props are required. It allows to reduce the number of renderings of dashboard itself from 30+ to 4 on a dashboard with 2 cards and 2 filters includes - `getEmbeddedParameterVisibility` has a stable reference - pageFavicon, documentTitle and other unnecessary for dashboard props are not passed down - `dashcardData` is used in dashcard visuzliation only - metadata and databases are calculated only in dashcards and dashboard header (databases can be reworked to a selector to optimize further) ### How to verify The best way to test it is to merge and check `customer 360` dashboard from stats, make sure CI is green ### Demo ### Before ### After
author: uladzimirdev
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Kondo linter tests for `:metabase/validate-logging`
body:
Introduce a way to run tests against Kondo linters. 

Convert the test `comment` examples for our custom `:metabase/validate-logging` linter to tests. This serves as an example of how to write tests for Kondo linters and a proof-of-concept.

To make this work I moved `.clj-kondo/hooks` to `.clj-kondo/src/hooks`; tests live in matching test namespace in `.clj-kondo/test/hooks`.

I added an alias so you can easily run Kondo linter tests with `clj -X:dev:test:test/kondo`.
author: camsaul

title: Only log views for cards in a dashboard if the user views the tab
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41892, assuming [the issue with pivot table cards and metrics v2](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064QMXEV9N/p1716513494230449?thread_ts=1716512794.557519&cid=C064QMXEV9N) is resolved.

The `view_count` for a card now is calculated by:
the number of successful POST /api/dashboard/:id/dashcard/:id/card/:id/query requests (and the public+embed equivalents)
+
the number of successful POST /api/dashboard/pivot/:id/dashcard/:id/card/:id/query requests (and the public+embed equivalents)
+
the number of successful GET /api/card/:id requests (and the public+embed equivalents)

### BE changes: 
Instead of logging views for all cards on a GET request for a dashboard, we now log views on each cards' query requests. The `:event/card-read` event is used for this purpose.

### FE changes: 
I've added/extended some e2e tests to verify the view counts are incremented correctly for regular, public, and embedded dashboards. I think I caught a bug in the process and reproduced it with tests, see this loom: https://www.loom.com/share/93ceb5c13c714c3eb7ad7b33bdf68f3c?sid=0ab113c7-5d8d-4f72-84ec-b0036f472401

title: Add Advanced Cache Upsell
body:
closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41119

see [discussion](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C06KX7QECN4/p1716475479960519)

### Description

- Adds a `useHasTokenFeature` hook
- Adds an upsell for advanced caching for admins that don't  have it
- Displays that upsell on the performance tab


![Screen Shot 2024-05-24 at 7 50 39 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/db785a43-c46f-4988-8068-1062c3a4bd43)



### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Allow recent command palette items with the same name
body:
Closes [bug](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C05MPF0TM3L/p1716501391373629?thread_ts=1716498078.961359&cid=C05MPF0TM3L)

### Description

Due to a quirk of our underlying command palette library, it wouldn't show two items with identical ids. We were using names as ids for recent items. This was causing us to lose recent items if a user had visited a table and a model with the same name. Search results use model + id, so they are safe.

Before | After
---|---
![Screen Shot 2024-05-23 at 4 14 31 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/bd5ad222-0d5e-4252-8d80-9348088e7d12) | ![Screen Shot 2024-05-23 at 4 14 07 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/cc99d6b1-d581-4f1a-8326-4fac97a2e240)



### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Implement graceful error handling for trend charts
body:
- Closes: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42948

---
**Before**

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/22608765/4fdb0c79-0a80-4f62-b409-a21deee76834

**After**


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/22608765/5af16d67-ad27-4389-b917-10d71bc48127

---
**Desired Behavior/Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] Trend charts no longer error when the latest value is null. `computeTrend` now finds the latest non-null data point and compares it with a the first non-null previous data point
- [ ] Trend chart no longer throws an error that it does not handle. If `computeTrend` throws an error, displays a warning icon and error message detailing the error.
  - [ ] You can continue using the query builder (w/o needing to refresh): switching to new chart types, viewing the data as a table, etc.
- [ ] Tests have been added to cover the above cases (`compute.unit.spec.js`, `smartscalar.unit.spec.js`, `smartscalar-trend.cy.spec.js`)
author: JesseSDevaney
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Allow disabling encryption for settings
body:
For two settings, we want to disable encryption entirely.

On the way out of the data source, we don't need to worry - the decryption is already backwards-compatible with non-encrypted data.

On the way in, things are a bit less straightforward. The core of the change is replacing the `t2/deftransform` that *always* runs `encryption/maybe-encrypt` on the value with:

- a define-after-select that always tries to decrypt the value (so we can handle existing encrypted values in the db)

- a define-before-insert that encrypts the value if the `defsetting` told us to, and

- a define-before-update that does the same thing.

For now, set two settings to be never-encrypted: `analytics-uuid` and `anon-tracking-enabled`.

On startup, we loop through all settings that should never be encrypted and decrypt them.

Fixes #42651
author: johnswanson

title: Time-over-time comparison aggregation helpers
body:
Closes #43079

### Description

3 helper functions, as specified in [[Tech] Time-over-time comparison UI for aggregated columns](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Tech-Time-over-time-comparison-UI-for-aggregated-columns-d06c46884d924bb99b814ec9d8f9b114).
I decided to define them in a new file since these are not really low-level "core" functions and IMO should not clutter `expression.ts` (BTW these aren't really aggregation-specific, they will work with custom columns and filters in the future).
It's going straight to `master` since the functions aren't used yet.
Includes test coverage according to [these product specs](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Time-over-time-comparison-UI-for-aggregated-columns-032bb9b47d124731baa9c3c7f954727f).




### How to verify

New tests pass.
Manually check if assertions in new tests cover [product specs](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Time-over-time-comparison-UI-for-aggregated-columns-032bb9b47d124731baa9c3c7f954727f) - especially the aggregation names.

title: Fix breakout pivot tether
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43075

Fixes an issue where the popover on the click actions in the visualization was placed with overflow on the window.

### Description

1. Adds a max height on the popover content 
2. Allow the click action popover to untether when necessary to prevent overflowing the viewport

### How to verify

1. New question -> Sample database -> People
2. Add an aggregation -> Count of rows -> Source
3. Visualize
4. Click on one of the visualization columns
5. Break out by
6. Time

The resulting popover should not overflow the screen.

### Demo
_Note: This demo artificially adds more content to the popover since we don't have big enough tables in the dev database for this to be a problem._

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/2db06d8f-dde3-4edd-b6bf-dcfba31bbc21
author: romeovs
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

This PR updates both of them, along with the top-level package which brings them in, for good measure. Non of the [breaking changes](https://github.com/google/zx/releases/tag/8.0.0) seem relevant to us.

title: Fix missing closing bracket in documentation SQL query
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]
> For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label
> to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this
> PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71)
> in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not
> apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> **Warning**
>
> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/[issue_number]

### Description

This merge request corrects a minor syntax error in the SQL query template example provided in the Metabase documentation. Specifically, it adds a missing closing bracket to the condition checking the id 

#### Changes made:

Added the missing closing bracket in the SQL query template example in the documentation:
```
Before:
  [[AND id = {{id}}]
After:
  [[AND id = {{id}}]]
```

### How to verify

To verify this change, follow these steps:

1. Open Metabase.
2. Create a new question and use the Sample Dataset.
3. Switch to the native query editor and run the following query

```
SELECT
  count(*)
FROM
  products
WHERE
  TRUE
  [[AND id = {{id}}]]
  [[AND {{category}}]]
```

### Demo

No demo video or screenshots are necessary for this change as it is a simple documentation correction.

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: [docs] Trash
body:
Rename archive to Trash, pull it out of History, and add explanations of how trashing affects related items.

Not sure if it should have a backport label considering RC1 was cut

Things to think about:

Name and content:
- This goes into ‚ÄúOrganization‚Äù topic so I thought ‚Äú‚Äùthe means/goal of organization action‚Äù (delete and restore) would be a better name than ‚Äùthe place where it goes‚Äù (Trash).
But then this also made me think that people might come to that article to learn about deleting items that don‚Äôt go into trash, so I added a bunch of links to other delete-like actions.

Article organization:

- There are a lot of repeated instructions which I don‚Äôt like. On the other hand, I wanted to have detailed section titles for better searcheability. Alternative would be to have delete/restore instructions as one section, and then separate the effects of delete actions into sections.

Downstream effects:
- I think I noted most of the possible consequences/interactions of deleting something, but let me know if I missed something!

title: Global fix for SDK theming
body:
Relates to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42694

### Description

This should fix all basic theming issues for the SDK - we will use theme colors in generated client styles.

This makes most colors in the project dynamic, so that theme config changes would affect generated styles on rerender (which will happen due to SDK provider state change).

### How to verify

Try to use updated components in SDK context.

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Rework popular_items to use recent_views and view_count columns
body:
Reworks the `api/activity/popular_items` endpoint implementation to read from the `recent_views` table instead of `view_log`, since we've stopped writing to the View Log on OSS. To maintain approximately the same algorithm, I'm joining on `report_dashboard` and `metabase_table` in order to use the `view_count` column.

Also threw in some general code cleanup.

body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36825

### Description

After refactoring the scatter plot to use separate code paths, we finally update the chart model types to have better separation.

Since there's a lot of files changed, it'll be easiest to start reviewing `echarts/cartesian/model/types.ts`

### How to verify

CI

body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36825

### Description

Refactors the scatter plot to it's own path. Consists of the initial commit and two child PRs that were merged manually.

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43032/commits/22a2d22b7bd475cb6d328c271b1cd8a5b1651ec8
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43033
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43034

### How to verify

CI

### Checklist

~- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~

Not applicable since this is a non-functional change, will be tested by existing tests.

title: Fix not being able to upload to a table if the uploads database has switched
body:
This PR fixes a bug with uploads on the FE, where switching the uploads database means you can't append to existing uploaded tables anymore.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Set the uploads database to database A
2. Upload a CSV file to database A. 
3. Check that you can append through the newly created model.
3. Set the uploads database to database B
4. You will not be able to see the button to append to the newly created model anymore.

We decided that users should be able to upload to an existing uploaded table after switching the uploads database [here](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C04S696LRUM/p1701874496054379).

This is totally possible on the BE but not from the UI.
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Properly show parent DBs in entity picker recents and search
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42978

### Description

Tables were showing up in recents and search as part of "our analytics" which is ... not true.

Before | After
---|---
![332575086-3fcc27a7-644e-4d14-b629-366eeb5199cb](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/30899b7c-1be4-4893-8ec0-cbf5fced901a) |  ![Screen Shot 2024-05-22 at 8 26 41 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/8a457e48-0cab-4be6-a139-f391240a9a12) ![Screen Shot 2024-05-22 at 8 26 32 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/f1fdbf3e-8cf6-4c19-8528-88093e101b16)


This also allows recent collection items to show their parent collection. This was previously disabled because search collection items have themselves populated as their parent ü•¥. This adds a more sophisticated check and hides only non-sensical collection parents (from the search API). see: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42979



### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: iethree
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]
