title: 42934 entity picker create collection root
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42934

### Description
When creating new entities, if we want something to belong to `Our Analytics`, we need to set the parent collection id of the new entity to `null`. This can be a bit awkward for the collection picker, which uses the identifier `root` instead. Within the `Create New Collection` and `Create New Dashboard` dialogs we check for "root" and replace it with null. This wasn't happening in `<NewCollectionDialog/>`

This PR fixes that, as well as adds unit tests for both modals 

### How to verify
1. New -> Collection
2. Open the collection picker, and click on a collection, then click "Our Analytics" (clicking away initially is important)
3. Click the "Create a new Collection" button on the bottom of the modal. You should be able to create a new collection under our analytics

### Demo
![chrome_EIhgOk8Wzb](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/a2bef39a-38b6-4ec5-bbc8-2c8e6dae4c70)

### Checklist
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: feat(admin/performance): Add tab for dashboard and questions overrides

This PR adds a table listing the dashboard and questions that have their own caching policies (which override other, more general policies that would otherwise be applied). Here's what it looks like:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c86ff82f-f098-4bab-b125-a2e860410af3)

Closes #42567

title: simplify db strategy editor markup
body:
follow up on https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39234#discussion_r1548536869

### Description

Simplifies the markup for the database strategy editor to no longer need to adjust css with `useLayoutEffect` at runtime.

Should look exactly the same as before, but be easier to maintain and perform better.

OSS | EE
---|---
![Screen Shot 2024-05-21 at 4 16 25 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/72031fd5-25e9-4584-b8c7-9d4af5e71b6b) | ![Screen Shot 2024-05-21 at 4 17 28 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/8ee6443d-6e6b-4918-949d-9ac4c967bf50)

title: Hide creation buttons on search and recents tabs
body:
Closes #42976

### Description

The "Create a dashboard" and "Create a collection" buttons were pretty confusing on the recents and search screens (they would create items in the root collection), this hides those buttons on the recents and search tabs.

![noNewOnSearchOrRecent](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/b54d4434-b161-41f4-add5-31f1fb296796)


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: [Metrics V2] Backfill viz settings for compatible-series
body:
Fixes #42575

The BE should rely on the query when there is no corresponding viz setting.
If there is no graph.metrics setting, assume that all last-stage aggregations are used.
No graph.dimensions -> use breakouts.

title: 42592 new modal adding database
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42592

### Description
This PR removes the old "Explore Sample Data" modal when adding a new database for the first time, with a modal that prompts you to go set permissions on the tables. 

### How to verify
1. Admin -> Database -> Add a new Database
2. After hitting Save, you should be redirected to the Database List page with a modal prompting you to add permissions to the tables.

### Demo
![chrome_pmyRJCOznr](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/9ce9cbc6-6067-4951-92c8-0bdda58d6994)

title: feat(sdk): override chart colors
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42685 ### Description We want to give users options to override the chart colors they've pre-defined in their appearance settings using the `theme.colors.charts` SDK theme settings. The `charts` array is an array of chart colors, which can either be a color string (most commonly used) or an object that defines a base color with an optional `shade` and `tint` variations. Note that when the shades and tints are not explicitly defined, they're automatically generated by the existing logic in `lib/colors/palette.ts` as part of the `aliases` object. ```ts { colors: { charts: [ "#e74c3c", "#6ab04c", { base: "#4834d4" }, { base: "#be2edd", lighter: "#e056fd" }, { base: "#30336b", darker: "#130f40" }, ], } } ``` ### Limitations **We cannot override the color of chart series yet.** The database stores the hex colors in `series_settings.[key].color` rather than a stable identifier that we can reliably correlate or map to the chart colors. We store the hex colors at that point in time in the database rather than a key to lookup the colors, so we won't be able to globally override all chart colors for now. Currently, this PR works for charts **without series color overrides applied**. It should work for all viz, including cartesian charts (bar, line, area), pie chart, funnel, waterfall and row chart. For cartesian charts, the default preferred colors will be applied according to summarization: count = `accent0`, sum = `accent1`, average = `accent2`. The above limitation will be addressed later. ### How to verify - Go to the `test-sdk-chart-colors` branch in the demo app - Go to `AppProvider.tsx`, and update `theme.colors.charts` to the colors you want to test. There can only be a maximum of 8 accent colors. - Go to the Kitchen Sink. The colors of the charts should change according to the chart colors. ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Load dashcard metadata in parallel with the query
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41468

Changes:
- Do not load metadata for all cards on the first dashboard tab upfront. Instead, load metadata on demand in the same place where query is executed, in parallel. 
- Modify parameters & dashcard menu to not parse the query (heavy operation) and work without metadata being loaded. Actually, it's not heavy to do it once, the problem arises when the query & metadata are re-parsed hundreds of times after each metadata item being loaded. 

How to verify:
- CI is green

title: Fix `report_card.collection_preview` in v49
body:
This is a bit painful. I merged this change, but realized we need to backport the fix to v49. However:

- we don't want to have two versions of the migration (one with a v49 id, one with a v50 id) because then if someone upgrades to 50, then downgrades to 49, the `rollback` will run and change the type back, leading to a bug.

- we don't want to push a v51 changeSet ID to v49 or v50, because we give the user a helpful notice when their database needs a downgrade. We do this by checking for the latest *executed* migration in the database and comparing it to the latest migration that Liquibase knows about, and making sure the executed isn't bigger than the known (e.g. you can't have executed a v51 migration if it isn't in the local migration yaml). That would all work fine, except that then we want to tell you how to downgrade your database, and we use the latest-executed version for that. So if, for example, someone upgraded from 48 to 49 and got a v51 changeset, then downgraded back to 48, they would get an error telling them to run the *v51* jar to roll back their DB.

In this case though, I think it's fine to just move the migration around to v49, then we can backport it to 49 and 50.
author: johnswanson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Fix failing offset tests
body:
### Description

The tests were failing because #38457 added `clear()` call to `enterCustomColumnDetails` and it got merged to `master` after #42756 has been submitted for review, so CI didn't catch this.

`release-x.50.x` is safe because #38457 was not merged to it.

----

See [Slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C5XHN8GLW/p1716289518525529)

Example failures:
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9172578557
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9170036603
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9170030131

title: Fixes for InteractiveQuestion theming
body:
Relates to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42560

### Description

This fixes some issues found in InteractiveQuestion theming:

- Add `shadow` color to SDK theming config.
- Add theming for `--mb-color-text-medium`, `--mb-color-text-light`.
- Fix HoverCard to be rendered in the SDK context.
- Fix text color in Add new column drill, Break-out by drill.
- Fix svg columns icons in drills

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. build SDK and use it with https://github.com/metabase/embedding-sdk-customer-zero/tree/42560-q-theming
2. change colors in https://github.com/metabase/embedding-sdk-customer-zero/blob/42560-q-theming/src/components/AppProvider.tsx#L33
3. Content should be updated according to the theme.

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: deniskaber

title: fix data labels under trend/goal lines
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41280

### Description

ECharts will set the z-index of data labels to be the same as their series. We fix the issue (data labels appearing under trend and goal lines) in two ways:

1. For line and area series, we set the z-index of the series to be the same as the z-index of the goal and trend lines. ECharts will automatically render data labels on top.

2. For bar series, we need a different solution, because bars inherently need to have a smaller z-index than area series, to ensure areas render on top of bars. So instead, we take a similar approach to stacked chart labels, and render separate series for the data labels that have a greater z-index.

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/54e66186-9ed9-474a-936e-25534ef9821d

Note: as shown in the demo an inherent limitation is that the bar series labels will render under the goal and trend lines when highlighting the series via the chart or legend. There's not really an easy way around this, since we can only highlight the series that renders the bars, and it needs to have a smaller z-index than line/area series, which have the same z-index as trend/goal lines. It seems like an acceptable tradeoff, since it only happens when hovering, and when not hovering the labels are still much more visible than before.

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/2fa14be1-83b8-46e8-8be6-31949b38967f

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: EmmadUsmani
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team'), ('loki-update', '')]

title: [Backport v50] Correct type for `report_card.collection_preview`
body:
In v49, we converted all boolean types to `bit(1)` on mysql/mariadb. It looks like we missed this one, so when you `GET` a card it has `"collection_preview": 1`. Then we get an error when trying to save, because `collection_preview` should be a boolean.

I verified that after this migration, `GET`ting a card results in a boolean `"collection_preview"`.

Backports https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/42919 / fixes #40600
author: johnswanson
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]
